alert.note: Alert for Darlington (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 5:16PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Darlington County through 545 PM EDT... At 515 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lydia, or near Hartsville, moving northeast at 15 mph, with a second storm north of North Hartsville. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hartsville, North Hartsville, Clyde, Dovesville, Oats, Lydia, Auburn, Floyd, Swift Creek, Kellytown and Carolina Pines Regional Medical Center. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 126 and 127. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
